channel.title: healthTest
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from healthTest, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fewer characters on TV had abortions this year — and more stories reinforced shame
item.description: Researchers at the University of California San Francisco track how abortion comes up on television. They say the trends from 2025 are concerning.

item.title: Winter virus season so far is not too bad, but doctors worry about suffering to come
item.description: It may feel like you are surrounded by sniffles and coughs, but flu season activity is still low in many parts of the U.S.

item.title: Why one trauma doctor sees self-driving cars as a 'public health breakthrough'
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to Dr. Jonathan Slotkin about the new data released by Waymo about accidents and their self-driving cars.

item.title: Lowering blood sugar can halve heart attack risk in people with prediabetes
item.description: Lowering blood sugar levels halves the likelihood of serious heart problems in people with prediabetes.
